subclusters.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation Resistance and Longevity Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial respiration as the main source of ROS causing oxidative damage to macromolecules driving aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative damage leading to metabolic dysfunction and aging.
Highlights oxidative damage to proteins and energy metabolism impairment in brain due to mitochondrial ROS.
Describes mitochondrial dysfunction as a major source of ROS causing cardiovascular aging.
Shows reduced mitochondrial ROS and enhanced antioxidant defense correlating with longevity.
Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction increasing ROS production and oxidative damage driving aging.
Describes mitochondrial ROS accumulation and antioxidant defenses modulating aging and lifespan.
Discusses ROS accumulation from metabolism and reproduction, and antioxidant defenses in long-lived termite queen.
Links oxidative stress from mitochondrial ROS and environmental stress to aging in social insects.
Proposes genetically programmed anticipatory antioxidant defense against ROS during reproduction.
Shows antioxidant defense (thioredoxin 1) modulating oxidative damage accumulation and lifespan.
Describes oxidative damage accumulation and antioxidant insufficiency causing cognitive decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Transgenerational Oxidative Stress and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress causing transgenerational inheritance of aging effects via germline DNA damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear DNA Damage-Driven Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative stress causing nuclear DNA damage, telomere shortening, and laminopathy-related aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Vascular Oxidative Stress and Xanthine Oxidase Activation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress from xanthine oxidase activation causing vascular aging and telomere shortening.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Ovarian Follicle Oxidative Stress Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress and antioxidant decline causing ovarian follicle aging and microenvironment impairment.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neurodegeneration and PTSD-Associated Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links chronic PTSD-induced oxidative stress and HPA axis dysregulation to accelerated brain aging and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metal Dyshomeostasis and Oxidative Stress Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on metal imbalance exacerbating oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction causing neurodegeneration.
Highlights dual role of ROS as damaging agents and signaling molecules activating protective pathways and longevity.
Describes mitohormesis where mild mitochondrial stress and ROS signaling induce adaptive longevity responses.
Details RAS-dependent ROS signaling pathway modulated by mitochondrial superoxide extending lifespan.
Proposes balance between superoxide toxicity and prosurvival signaling determines lifespan effects.
Explains hormesis where low ROS levels induce adaptive protective responses promoting healthspan and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation Resistance and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on species differences in cellular resistance to oxidative protein damage correlating with lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation Resistance and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows long-lived bats have enhanced resistance to protein oxidation and better protein homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation Resistance and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes repair and elimination of oxidatively damaged proteins as key anti-aging strategies.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation Resistance and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes small-molecule Mn antioxidants complementing enzymatic defenses to protect proteins from oxidative damage.
